channel.title: Chaotic Good Computing
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Chaotic Good Computing

item.title: Goblin Slaying (a.k.a Productivity)
item.description: Goblin slaying is a somewhat underhanded term for productivity habits and tools.

item.title: Digital Gardening, and Horticulture as Research
item.description: As a logical consequence of taking a digital gardening approach to writing, the horticulture tag will be used to catalog thoughts related to digital gardening and general research.

item.title: Daily Notes
item.description: These are daily notes, where I log and track progress on ongoing projects and make notes for myself later. These are largely for my own benefit, and are here in case they’re helpful to myself (or, somehow, others) in the future.

item.title: Spencer's Notes
item.description: These are notes - they’re things that are structured, albeit not necessarily as structured or refined as CGC articles. In general, there are three kinds of notes I make: General notes, which are found on this page Daily Notes, which contain daily logs for my own benefit Scratch Notes, which really just means “none of the above” .

item.title: Scratch Notes
item.description: For all intents and purposes, these are the digital gardening equivalent of shitposts and shower thoughts.

item.title: Day Job Projects
item.description: For obvious reasons, anything related to these projects will be very vague.
